column4: can anyone help me get my videos and mp3's to play on my new ubuntu 8.04? i thought i'd installed all the necessary codecs with ubuntu-restricted.. but i guess not maybe?
just install totem with the xine backend
i did that.. but how do i know if it's running? it still eff's up
how do i switch between -xine and -gstreamer for totem?
i get stuttering video.. no audio.. rhythmnbox doesnt play mp3's either..
i do, but where is the totem-xine, or should i uninstall gstreamer?
ok, i uninstalled totem-gstreamer, and then the video seemed to play all right for about 30seconds.. and then it froze, and  totem crashed
it seems to have at least one of each of those sets.. it doesn't have a few packages from each of those sets, usually with suffix -db or -dc etc.
i had all those things installed before..
um, now it's playing back in blue shades
and it's again slow and stuttering.. nos ound either..
where's the totem folder im supposed to delee?
still blue and slow and stuttering with no audio
